text: right here with the wonderful Judith
Light one of the great actresses of this
century a transparent and also obviously
on Broadway and television in all kinds
of ways what makes the Screen Actors
Guild Award special for you I think I
might have even become a member in like
1975 and so for me it's the union that
really supports all of us and all of us
really get to be with our peers this is
this is our night to be with our friends
and so it's really an acknowledgement of
the way the Union works how well it
works and how connected we all get to be
do you remember your very first time on
a red carpet what that was like oh my
god what a good question I don't I'm
sorry it's such a good question but I
really I really don't remember my first
time in a row must have been must have
been when I was doing who's the boss if
it had to have been that it has to have
been that time what goes through your
mind when you're walking down the red
carpet are you channeling your inner
Beyonce what are you thinking about the
red carpet you guys these are such
wonderful questions actually I think
about what my responsibility is to the
people that I'm here to support and
tonight I get to support jeffrey tambor
who he and I have worked together for
over 40 years and we're really longtime
friends and so I'm here tonight to
support him and to support our show
transparent and so what I think about
when I get here is and when I'm when I'm
preparing to come here is the gift that
I that this affords me the gratitude
that I have
and the kind of connection that I have
to the people that I love now when
you've got the script for transparent
one of the things I always ask people
from this company is you didn't know
that you were going to be part of a
social movement you you just had a great
script does it still sort of take you
aback just the the amount of change that
that show seems to have just written on
this wave of enormous social activism
and discussion about gender issues in
America and obviously right now in terms
of the political controversies that are
going on how does that affect you as a
caster you talk about that do you talk
about what's going on in terms of in
individual states right now there's
obviously some discussion about rolling
back some of the advances that have been
made we talk about it all the time and
know when we got the script we didn't
know what this was gonna be we knew that
Jill Soloway wanted to change the
conversation she wanted to change the
culture she wanted to make the world a
different place in a safer place and
particularly for her parent who this was
written for and about and we didn't know
that we were we were became part of a
movement this movement was already going
this is something that many of us have
been advocating for for a long time and
this is the transgender community has
been and had been too long in the
shadows and so the fact that we moved
into the zeitgeist of what was something
that was already in process has made us
all feel incredibly humble and that
every year and every season jill starts
off the season and we talk about it at
every table read that we have how
grateful we are that we get to be part
of this and talk about this and that she
has the kind of vision that she has and
our writers go along with that and so
does the rest of the cast so we have a
great deal of gratitude for what we get
to be able I know you've changed a lot
of lie
and I think it's pretty exciting to have
you here and I know Jill's such a
visionary so congratulations Jeffrey and
and thanks for supporting the Screen
Actors Guild AFTRA thank you thank you
for having me and thank you for such
